positions.title: Assistant Registrar-Systems and Curriculum Office of the Registrar
positions.description:
The Assistant Registrar for Systems and Curriculum works under general direction to manage the degree audit system, including programming, maintenance, testing, end-user training, and the development of
documentation and materials. The management of this system requires in-depth knowledge of the degree audit software and student information system. Applies knowledge of UC Merced academic policies and program requirements to automate business processes and practices. This position
also oversees the campus entry of transfer credit, which includes partnering with Admissions. The position is also responsible for the oversite of the campus Curriculum Management system (curriculog) which includes system maintenance and improvements. Works with the Office of the Registrar and Schools representatives to recommend changes to policies, practices, and procedures related to academic requirements and degree completion. This position is a part of the Office of the Registrar
leadership team.

positions.title: Assistant Director of Operations and Business Analysis
positions.description:
Responsible for all procedures and business processes associated with Document Intake, Satisfactory Academic Progress and Communications. Responsibilities include designing business processes to efficiently manage day-to-day workflow in the Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships by analyzing new and current business processes, developing policies and procedures to support those business processes, recommending changes to existing departmental policies and practices,
providing direction to staff, identifying risks and responding accordingly, coordinating and leveraging system resources and setting priorities for implementation of new and redesigned business processes.
positions.locationName: Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships

positions.title: Operations Manager
positions.description: Oversight responsibility for all aspects of the document intake process. Oversee collection and coding of all incoming documents: review for completion, determine necessity for additional documentation request, code correctly in the system and route accordingly.Oversee all communication avenues from the OFAS. Generate, review and formalize all forms and publications to ensure consistency and compliance throughout. Oversee OFAS website to ensure accurate and timely information and instructions for both new and continuing undergraduate and graduate students. Implement and manage systems to ensure integrity and security of all publishable information including forms/documents, website, letters/e-mails, and both electronic and print publications.Monitor and process all student withdrawals (official and unofficial) for the purpose of maintaining compliance with Federal, State and Institutional Regulations. Perform R2T4 calculations and initiate the accurate return of aid to appropriate Federal, State and Outside agencies. Oversight responsibility for all student appeals (on-time status, Satisfactory Academic Progress, Scholarship, etc.) Maintain documentation on requests and decisions and serve as staff and/ or chair to appropriate committees. Manage the Satisfactory Academic Progress system according to Federal, State and Institutional regulations. Determine studentsâ€™ eligibility, apply appropriate holds and notify students appropriately. Supervise staff & student employees, manage schedules, assign work/projects, review and submit timesheets, carry out disciplinary actions, work with other agencies/departments in the hire and termination of a student employee

positions.title: Operations Specialist for Office of Financial Aid and Scholarships
positions.description: Responsible for creating and maintaining document intake and assessment processing. Review and update the website to ensure accurate and timely information and instructions for new and continuing undergraduate and graduate students.  Monitored and processed all student withdrawals (official and unofficial) to comply with Federal, State, and InstitutionalRegulations. ManageStudentAppealProcessand process through appropriate channels.  Create and maintain documentation regarding requests and decisions. Satisfactory AcademicProgressSystemassistedin managing the Satisfactory Academic Progress system according to Federal, State, and Institutional regulations.  Determine student eligibility, apply appropriate holds, and notify students appropriately. Responsible for implementing extensive publications and communications while staying within compliance with State, Federal, and Institutional financial aid policies.

positions.title: Financial Aid Advisor
positions.description: Professional who applies acquired job skills, policies, and procedures to complete substantive assignments/projects/tasks of moderate scope and complexity; exercises judgment within defined guidelines and practices to determine appropriate action.
